Game.Name: NBA All-Star Challenge (USA, Europe)
Game.plot: Overview:NBA All-Star Challenge is a one-on-one basketball game featuring 27 NBA star players from professional NBA teams, as of 1992. The player can select from a regular one-on-one game, a free-throw contest, a three-pointer contest and H.O.R.S.E., in which a player scores and the opponent has to do the same from the same spot.The game was published for Super Famicom by Acclaim Japan, Super Nintendo by LJN, and Genesis by Flying Edge. It was developed by Beam Software, now known as Krome Studios.Players FeaturedAlvin Robertson (Milwaukee Bucks)Bernard King (Washington Bullets)Brad Daugherty (Cleveland Cavaliers)Charles Barkley (Phoenix Suns)Chris Mullin (Golden State Warriors)Clyde Drexler (Portland Trail Blazers)Danny Manning (Los Angeles Clippers)David Robinson (San Antonio Spurs)Derek Harper (Dallas Mavericks)Derrick Coleman (New Jersey Nets)Dikembe Mutombo (Denver Nuggets)Dominique Wilkins (Atlanta Hawks)Hakeem Olajuwon (Houston Rockets)Hersey Hawkins (Philadelphia 76ers)Isiah Thomas (Detroit Pistons)J.R. Reid (Charlotte Hornets)James Worthy (Los Angeles Lakers)Karl Malone (Utah Jazz)Larry Bird (Boston Celtics)Michael Jordan (Chicago Bulls)Mitch Richmond (Sacramento Kings)Patrick Ewing (New York Knicks)Reggie Miller (Indiana Pacers)Rony Seikaly (Miami Heat)Scott Skiles (Orlando Magic)Shawn Kemp (Seattle Supersonics)Tony Campbell (Minnesota Timberwolves)
Game.Notes: NBA All-Star Challenge offers one-on-one basketball featuring NBA players from the 1991-1992 season. Five different playing modes are available: a single one-on-one match, a free throw competition, a 3 point shootout, a H.O.R.S.E. competition and a one-on-one tournament. You can choose from 27 players (one from every NBA team), including Michael Jordan, Larry Bird, Patrick Ewing, Karl Malone and David Robinson. Each mode can also be played by two players.
